title: Cuban Style Picadillo
directions: Mix all dry spices together in a bowl – cumin, oregano, salt, and pepper. Make sure to mix well.
Combine 2 ½ teaspoons of spice mixture to raw ground beef. Massage into meat and let sit at room temperature while preparing other ingredients (at least 20 min)
Heat pan with 2 tablespoons of olive oil at medium-high heat
Add onions and bell peppers to pan and sauté until onions are translucent (about 2-3 min)
Add minced garlic and mix together. Cook for another 2 min
Add chopped tomatoes, tomato sauce, and 1 ½ teaspoons of spice mixture. Cook for another 2-3 min
Add capers, olives, bay leaves, and ¼ cup of wine. Cook for another 4-5 min
Remove mixture from pan and set aside.

Add meat to pan and brown. This should take about 5 min. If there is a lot of liquid in pan you can remove. Meat shouldn’t be completely dry, but you also don’t want it sitting in a pool of liquid. Liquid should not come above meat.
Once meat is browned add sauce mixture back to pan. Also add remaining spice mixture (1 tablespoon) and ¼ cup of wine. Cook for about 4-5 min
Add peas and raisins to pan. Cook for an additional 2-3 min
Top with fresh cilantro and mix well
Serve with steamed rice and top with a fried egg(optional)!
ingredients: ½ cup of Dry Red Cooking Wine
